channel.title: Comments on: Sweet Plantain Mini Cakes

item.title: By: Amy
item.dc:creator: Amy
item.description: It tastes like yellow cake! These lil’ cakes are so good. I def wouldn’t recommend them as a breakfast, but as a sweet treat to celebrate some sort of occasion. I used a very black and mushy plantain and one that had just started turning mainly black from yellow. The tops got a wee bit burnt at the 40min mark so I’ll need to keep a closer eye on them in the future since sweet plantains can burn so quickly. I’m excited to make this again for a birthday of some sort and maybe even create a topping for them.
item.content:encoded: It tastes like yellow cake! These lil’ cakes are so good. I def wouldn’t recommend them as a breakfast, but as a sweet treat to celebrate some sort of occasion. I used a very black and mushy plantain and one that had just started turning mainly black from yellow. The tops got a wee bit burnt at the 40min mark so I’ll need to keep a closer eye on them in the future since sweet plantains can burn so quickly. I’m excited to make this again for a birthday of some sort and maybe even create a topping for them.

item.title: By: Stephanie
item.dc:creator: Stephanie
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/sweet-plantain-mini-cakes/#comment-407">Tara M Dickinson</a>.
Hi Tara, I would recommend avoiding squash or pumpkin since it might add too much moisture compared to a ripe plantain. Instead, I would try out a banana instead if you have one available to you. Let me know how the recipe works out for you!
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Tara M Dickinson.

Hi Tara, I would recommend avoiding squash or pumpkin since it might add too much moisture compared to a ripe plantain. Instead, I would try out a banana instead if you have one available to you. Let me know how the recipe works out for you!

item.title: By: Tara M Dickinson
item.dc:creator: Tara M Dickinson
item.description: Hi, I only have one ripe plantain around. Should I half the recipe or can I substitute squash or pumpkin (the 2 other things I have around at this moment). thx!
item.content:encoded:
Hi,
I only have one ripe plantain around. Should I half the recipe or can I substitute squash or pumpkin (the 2 other things I have around at this moment). thx!

item.title: By: Stephanie
item.dc:creator: Stephanie
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/sweet-plantain-mini-cakes/#comment-24">Rachel</a>.
Hi Rachel, I haven't tried eggs so I can't speak from personal experience but I think it should work just fine. I would try replacing the gelatin egg with one egg and let me know how it works for you.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Rachel.

Hi Rachel, I haven’t tried eggs so I can’t speak from personal experience but I think it should work just fine. I would try replacing the gelatin egg with one egg and let me know how it works for you.

item.title: By: Rachel
item.dc:creator: Rachel
item.description: If I've found eggs work for me, could I sub a chicken/duck egg for the gelatin egg?
item.content:encoded: If I’ve found eggs work for me, could I sub a chicken/duck egg for the gelatin egg?
